snippet.title: Bitcoin is breaking records
snippet.content:
The is hovering at a record high on Monday, following a surge over the weekend.
Bitcoin is up 0.96% against the dollar to $US3,260.80 at 10.07 a.m. BST (5.07 a.m. ET). It follows a rally for the cryptocurrency on Saturday that saw it break through $US3,200 per coin for the first time ever. It reached an all-time high of $US3,344 per coin over the weekend.
Meanwhile, the price of Bitcoin Cash, at the start of the month, The price is recovering on Monday, up 28% to $US271.71, .
Mati Greenspan, an analyst at trading platform eToro, says Bitcoin Crash's dip and Bitcoin's rally are likely related.
Greenspan writes in an email on Monday morning: "All that money that seemingly came out of thin air to pump up the value of Bitcash is now being fed right into Bitcoin. Bitcash has fallen from its peak of $US12 Billion all the way down below $US4 Billion this morning.
"Bitcash sought to replace the original form of digital money but the miners never embraced it. As it was seen by many as something for nothing, many users are now dumping." ()
